Anagram Checker

By Mariah Dunn For Duolingo

View on GitHub Download .zip

This is an anagram checker. It can handle numbers and letters. There is also a check box to turn on and off whether or not capital letters should be counted in the anagram. Spaces are counted as letters. Empty strings are not counted as anagrams.

*This website has only been tested on Chrome Version 47 with Windows 10. Depending on the JavaScript version installed for your browser there may be different behavior.

**This is a checkbox to handle the special edge case with Japanese and Korean fonts. I used different fonts in the boxes to demonstrate this issue. In many Japanese and Korean Fonts (such as Yu Gothic or Malgun Gothic) the back slash character (U+005c) is hard coded to be a Yen or Won symbol respectively. The scenario handles the case for Yu Gothic. To test this scenario, type a backslash into each box, notice that a yen symbol is in the first box and a backslash is in the second box. Click the anagram button and notice that the status box briefly explains this issue. This will only work correctly if you have the Yu Gothic font installed on your OS.
